title: ComparativeEvidence: Mean difference in HbA1c between Surgery and Medical/Lifestyle groups in Ikramuddin 2015
description: Mean HbA1c at 24 months in Ikramuddin 2015 was 6.5% in Surgery group (n = 56) and 8.4% in Medical/Lifestyle group (n = 54), mean difference -1.90% (95% CI -2.78% to -1.02%)

variableDefinition.description: 110 patients aged 30-67 years with HbA1c of at least 8%, BMI between 30 and 39.9 and T2DM for at least 6 months

observed.display: Ikramuddin 2015 (Diabetes Surgery Study) Trial Enrollment Group

variableDefinition.description: Roux-en-Y gastric bypass vs. medical treatment (intensive lifestyle and medical management)
variableDefinition.comparatorCategory: Lifestyle-intensive medical management intervention based on the Diabetes Prevention Program and LookAHEAD trials for 2 years

observed.display: GroupAssignment: Roux-en-Y gastric bypass surgery vs. Lifestyle-intensive medical management intervention alone

note.text: Mean HbA1c at 24 months in Ikramuddin 2015 was 6.5% in Surgery group (n = 56) and 8.4% in Medical/Lifestyle group (n = 54)

name: ComparativeEvidence_Mean_difference_in_HbA1c_between_Surgery_and_Medical_Lifestyle_groups_in_Ikramuddin_2015

relatesTo.targetMarkdown: ComparativeEvidence: Mean difference in HbA1c between Surgery and Medical/Lifestyle groups in Ikramuddin 2015 [Evidence].
